    protected java.lang.String toSql​(boolean preparedStmt)
    Makes a few blanked tweaks to the sql created by the SqlQuery superclass to make it Cosmos compliant Replaces: SELECT "table".* FROM "table" -> SELECT * FROM table "table"."column" -> table["column"]

    • toSql

      protected java.lang.String toSql​(boolean preparedStmt)
      Makes a few blanked tweaks to the sql created by the SqlQuery superclass to make it Cosmos compliant Replaces:
    • SELECT "table".* FROM "table" -> SELECT * FROM table
    • "table"."column" -> table["column"]
      • Overrides:
      toSql in class SqlQuery<CosmosDb>

    • getDefaultSorts

      protected java.util.List<Order.Sort> getDefaultSorts​(SqlQuery.Parts parts)
      The inversion configured primary index should contain at least the document identifier and the partition key. If you don't supply a sort key on the query string that would default to adding two fields to the sort. If you did not configure cosmos to have a compound search index, that would fail...simply solution...if you did not supply a sort on the query string, just search by the "id" field.
      Overrides:
      getDefaultSorts in class SqlQuery<CosmosDb>

    • printLimitClause

      protected java.lang.String printLimitClause​(SqlQuery.Parts parts, int offset, int limit)
      Both offset and limit are required per cosmos spec.
      Overrides:
      printLimitClause in class SqlQuery<CosmosDb>

    • asVariableName

      protected java.lang.String asVariableName​(int valuesPairIdx)
      Cosmos does not use "?" ansii sql style prepared statement vars, it uses named variables prefixed with '@'.
